data.title: How Peter Shor Changed Physics
data.text:
APS March Meeting 2024

Monday–Friday, March 4–8, 2024; Minneapolis & Virtual

Session W43: Thirty Years of Quantum Computing since Shor's Algorithm

3:00 PM–6:00 PM, Thursday, March 7, 2024

Room: Auditorium 1

Sponsoring Units: FHPP DQI

Chair: Christopher Fuchs, University of Massachusetts Boston

Abstract: W43.00004 : How Peter Shor Changed Physics

4:48 PM–5:24 PM

Abstract

Presenter:

John P Preskill

(California Institute of Technology)

Author:

John P Preskill

(California Institute of Technology)

I will discuss Peter Shor’s major discoveries in the 1990s (superpolynomial quantum speedups, quantum error correction, and fault-tolerant quantum computation), and some of the ways these developments have enriched our understanding of the physical world.
